STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 26, 2022
Brandon Hannah
Ennis Center For Children - Flint
129 E. Third
Flint, MI 48502
RE: License #: CB250201108
Ennis Center For Children - Flint
129 E. Third
Flint, MI 48502
Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 04/25/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and MISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home
In one out of eight foster children records reviewed, one was six
d a y s late for the initial services plan dated 11/5/21 – 12/4/21.
The report was submitted on 12/10/21.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Four of 26 updated service plans (USP) reviewed were late:
One child’s:
 2/23/21 – 5/23/21 USP was completed one day late on
5/24/2021.
 5/24/21 – 8/21/21 USP was completed eleven days late
on 9/1/21.
A second child’s:
 5/13/21 – 8/10/21 USP was completed two days late on
8/12/2021.
A third child’s:
 6/17/21 – 9/14/21 USP was completed 1 day late on
9/15/2021.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL INSPECTION
2/18/2021, CAP APPROVED 2/26/2021
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver
Page 2
The individual activities required by the foster
parent/caregiver to meet the specific individual needs of
the child placed in their home are included in the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required
and indicates that the foster parent/caregiver
acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to meet
the needs of the child in their care. Additionally, the PATP
details the services and activities provided by the foster
care worker to assist the foster parent/caregiver in caring
for the child.
In five of eight open foster care records reviewed, the PATP’s were late and signed
30 days pass the reporting period:
One child:
2/23/21 – 5/23/21, the foster parent signed the PATP report on 8/23/21.
Second child:
5/13/21 – 8/10/21, foster parent signed the PATP report on 12/16/21. The
parent signed the same report 1/13/2022.
8/11/21 – 11/8/21, parent signed the PATP report on 1/13/2022.
Third child:
1/30/21 – 4/29/21, foster parent signed the PATP report on 6/22/2021.
Fourth child:
10/4/21 – 12/6/21, foster parent signed the PATP report 3/8/2022.
5

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP on 2/26/2021 for their renewal inspection dated
2/18/2021. The agency was found in non-compliance with the following:
400.12327 Special evaluation
400. 12418 Development of service plans
400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
MCL 722.112a Policy
MDHHS Policy SRM 200
MDHHS Policy 722.03E Placement Exception request
MDHHS Policy 722.06B Family Team Meetings
MDHHS Policy 722.06H Caseworker contact with parents/caregiver
MDHHS Policy 722.06H Timely entry of caseworker contacts
MDHHS Policy 722.08 Foster Care, Initial service plan (ISP)
MDHHS Policy 722.09 Supervisory approval: Updated service plans
MDHHS Policy 723 Educational services
MDHHS Policy 801.01 Health Requirements
MDHHS Policy 801.03 Medical Passports
MDHHS Policy ADM 300 Child Adoption Assessment
MDHHS Policy ADM 330 Quarterly Adoption Assessment
The agency was found in repeat non-compliance with R400.12418 for this interim
inspection.
VII. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS:
6

The Analyst’s inspection found two safety alerts:
Concern:
1. The bedroom designated for the foster children did not have doors.
Solution:
Doors were placed on the rooms effective 3/2122 and pictures are attached to
demonstrate this.
Concern:
2. The relative has a bedroom in her basement that doesn't have a means of
egress.
Solution:
The relative agreed to not allow any children in the basement when the adult
bedroom is in the basement. There is no room upstairs for the relative to
reside. The room is near the stairs for exit. The relative has been referred to
licensure to see if this can be addressed through the FIG grant.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Ennis – Flint continue on a
regular license.
04/26/2022

Pinkey Brown Date
